snippet: Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin of West Virginia, a Democrat, vetoed a proposal for a second straight year that would allow people 21 and older to carry hidden guns without permits or training.
abstract: West Virginia Gov Earl Ray Tomblin vetoes proposed legislation that would make it legal for those 21 years of age or older to carry concealed firearms without permits or training; is second time in as many years Tomblin has vetoed measure.
lead_paragraph: Gov. Earl Ray Tomblin of West Virginia, a Democrat, vetoed a proposal for a second straight year that would allow people 21 and older to carry hidden guns without permits or training.

headline.main: West Virginia: Bill to Loosen Curbs on Concealed Guns is Vetoed
headline.print_headline: West Virginia: Bill to Loosen Curbs on Concealed Guns Is Vetoed
